course.subject: MATH
course.name: Time Series Analysis
course.description: Basic idea of time series analysis in both the time and frequency domains. Topics include: autocorrelation, partial ACF, Box and Jerkins ARIMA modeling, spectrum and periodogram, order selection, diagnostic and forecasting. Real life examples will be used throughout the course.

reviews.author: Avik
reviews.comment_content: There were random proofs in the blackboard for 13 weeks. Without a research experience in Mathematics it will be impossible to appreciate anything.
reviews.comment_teaching: Really Boring, There were no real life application that were discussed. The English of the instructor was not at par and more often he will be using mandarin to talk with his students.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading depends on your performance in the final exam. It is unknown since final exam grades are unknown. However, if you complete the proof in accurate way you may get A.
reviews.comment_workload: There were no homework assignments, no mid term exam. Final exam was take home. The final exam paper was difficult and requires lot of effort.

reviews.author: Chuck
reviews.title: Outdated Materials
reviews.comment_content: The data used in the lecture slides are very outdated (more than 10 years ago). The notations used in lecture slides are different from the notation used in the software R, which makes the student hard to understand the materials. There are not many real life application but the material in the lecture can get you prepared for the interview questions especially for the quantitative role in the financial industry.
reviews.comment_teaching: It was hard for the students to follow the instructor as the instructor was not well prepared before the lecture. Not all the programming codes were uploaded before the class, so it wasted lots of time to check what we had downloaded and to ask others in the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading depends on the performance in the final exam and assignments as everyone get similar marks in the projects. It is noted that more than half of the people can get A range.
reviews.comment_workload: There were assignments, project and final exam. The assignments were difficult and required lots of effort as the students need to learn R and to read the textbook themselves. The project was routine and everyone got similar marks so there was nothing to highlight.

reviews.author: TT
reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.comment_content: Did not like this course at all. The professor just talks random proofs for 13 weeks and doesn't even introduce the topics, or relate it to real world applications at any point. Don't know anything about time series after finishing this course, just got slightly better at proofs..
reviews.comment_teaching: Professors english is not too good, and his notes on the blackboard are really confusing. No textbook except for his homemade lecture notes, which are really bad. Also some handwritten notes that he had scanned, not even bothered to write it nicely in latex.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was 0. Just show up for the lectures. No exercises, no homework, no midterm, just the final take-home exam.
